newsitem.title: USA: Washington Scientific Q2 margins improve.
newsitem.headline: Washington Scientific Q2 margins improve.

text.p: Washington Scientific Industries Inc said Wednesday its gross margins increased to 15.4 percent in the second quarter ended February 23 from 5.1 percent in the year-earlier period.
The company attributed a turnaround in its results for the second quarter ended February 23 to an improvement in its gross margins.

Earlier, Washington Scientific, a contract manufacturer, reported second quarter earnings of $0.09 a share, up from $0.02 a year ago. The year-ago quarter included an $0.18 a share gain from the disposition of excess equipment, which offset a $0.16 operating loss.
The company said the expansion of its margins was due to improvements in all areas of manufacturing.
Long-term debt was cut to $3,180,000 in the first half of fiscal 1997 from $4,124,000 a year ago.

Michael Pudil, president, said the outlook for the second half of fiscal 1997 is positive. He said the company currently expects to record further sales growth and year-over-year improvements in margins and operating earnings.
No dispositions of equipment are anticipated in the third or fourth quarters of the fiscal year, the company said.
